intro: Monanthotaxis atewensis, commonly known as the Atewen's monanthotaxis, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of western Africa. It belongs to the family Annonaceae, which includes many economically important trees and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or greenish in color. It produces fruit that is usually a capsule containing numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a threatened species.
